title: Rainfall & seasonality
text: Umbrella facilitates access extraction CHIRPS rainfall data fitting seasonal profiles. package leans heavily data functionality : CHIRPS: Please see CHIRPS website information, usage rights citation infromation. Google Earth Engine: Please see (sign ) Google Earth Engine rgee: superb R package acessing processing data Google Earth Engine. Please see rgee info.

title: Rainfall & seasonality
text: Please install GitHub : also need sign Google Earth Engine follow set instructions rgee using umbrella. estimate fourier series representing general seasonal profiles given rainfall setting using following equation  g0, g1, g2, g3, h1, h2, h3 fitted parameters. equation can fitted linear model using Rs lm function. However, impose additional constraint fitting: rainfall floor. sets minimum lower bound value rainfall. constraint fit resulting model nlm() function.

title: Extract mean daily precipitation — pull_daily_rainfall
text: sf simple features object. See sf details. geometry list-column must named "geometry". start_date First extraction time point. string format: "yyyy-mm-dd". end_date Last extraction time point. string format: "yyyy-mm-dd".

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: sym() creates symbol string syms() creates list symbols character vector. enquo() enquos() delay execution one several function arguments. enquo() returns single quoted expression, like blueprint delayed computation. enquos() returns list quoted expressions. expr() quotes new expression locally. mostly useful build new expressions around arguments captured enquo() enquos(): expr(mean(!!enquo(arg), na.rm = TRUE)). as_name() transforms quoted variable name string. Supplying something else quoted variable name error. unlike as_label() also returns single string supports kind R object input, including quoted function calls vectors. purpose summarise object single label. label often suitable default name. know quoted expression contains (instance expressions captured enquo() variable name, call function, unquoted constant), use as_label(). know quoted simple variable name, like enforce , use as_name(). learn tidy eval use tools, visit https://tidyeval.tidyverse.org Metaprogramming section Advanced R.
